N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5905.5 - Application requirements

State Regulations

Prior to completing the Federal SBIR Phase I research, a firm
may submit to the executive director of the foundation an application for a

State research contract, which shall contain the following information: (a) A copy of the firm's complete Federal
SBIR Phase I proposal. (b) A
detailed description of a product based on the Phase I research that addresses
a discernable market need and an analysis of the potential to produce, market, and service that product; (c) Certification by the firm that: (1)
the firm
is a corporation, partnership, sole proprietorship or individual, operating a
business for profit, with 250 employees or less, including employees employed
in any subsidiary or affiliated corporation, which otherwise meets the
requirements of the Act; (2)
all
research to be conducted and supported by the State research contract award
shall be performed solely in New York State; (3)
no State research contract award shall be
expended for travel, equipment, or facilities; (4)
not more than one-third of State research
contract award shall be used to contract for research and other related
purposes; (5)
the firm's principal
place of business is and will remain in New York State during the conduct of

Federal SBIR Phase II research. (d) A copy of the firm's most recent annual
financial statement. Notes
